availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry "Harry" Thompson (Cleveland, OH, major and adjt. 23rd O.V.I. )

body.p: Cleveland, Ohio, resident and soldier. Native of England. Son of William H. Thompson. Resident of Cleveland in 1860. Served in the 23rd Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant, major, and adjutant from May 18, 1861, to July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Cuyahoga County, Cleveland, Ward 4, p. 457.
Ohio, U.S., Soldier Grave Registrations, 1804-1958, Graves Registration Cards Collection, Ohio History Connection, Columbus, Ohio (accessed via Fold3.com).
Reid Whitelaw, Ohio in the War: Her Statesmen, Her Generals, and Soldiers (Cincinnati, OH: Moore, Wilstach & Baldwin, 1868), 158.
Find A Grave, "Maj Harry Thompson (1839-1872)," Memorial #128856252, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/128856252 (accessed January 22, 2021).
